Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

plot¶

roipy.plot Module¶

useful plots to use in ipython sessions

roipy.plot.baseline_both(Set)¶

Sort by increasing temoral baseline, after Casu et al 2008 fig2

roipy.plot.baseline_perp(Set)¶

bargraph of baselines for each interferogram in set

roipy.plot.baseline_plot(Set)¶

python version of the classic baseline plot. assumes set of interferograms already exists & just connects the dots

roipy.plot.baseline_time(Set)¶

bargraph of time separation for each ig in set

roipy.plot.browse3(tsInstance, prefix1='RmpMskDef', prefix2='synthetic', prefix3='residual')¶

Plot two arrays with imshow, keep the same colorbar for each, third array has it’s own colorbar scale (eg. for residual)

roipy.plot.browseRamps(tsInstance, prefix1='MskDef', prefix2='ramp', prefix3='RmpMskDef', signalmask='mask.npy')¶

Show ramps removed from interferograms

roipy.plot.browseSet(Set)¶
roipy.plot.browseTimeseries(Timeseries, prefix='')¶

Make a matplotlib window with a slider to quickly browse through IGs IGs must be in .bin binary format output by matlab

roipy.plot.calc_timeseries(tsInstance, cumdef=None, index=None, showloc=False)¶

Extract cumulative deformation values for plotting

roipy.plot.caxis(fig, limits=(-1, 1))¶

change colobar limits of currently active figure

roipy.plot.correlate(pixX=None, pixY=None, rows=None, order=1)¶

Correlate values of two coregistered 2D arrays.

Make plot of dem height vs unwrapped phase, if binning specify pixel box size. eg =[700,1000] for the salar de atacama subregion. order=n where n is the order of best-fit polynomial >>>InSAR.Plot.correlate(phs,hgt,rows=[700,1000],order=1)

roipy.plot.data_frames(ts, fwidth=17.0, fheight=11.0, nrow=4, normalize=True, show=True, outname='proofsheet.pdf', cbar='each', prefix='RmpMskDef', ylabeldate=False)¶

Make a ‘proof sheet’ of all frames in time series default 17x11 paper format. cbar can be ‘single’ (normalized to min/max of set?)

roipy.plot.date_igrams(ts, date, nrow=1, prefix='RmpMskDef', cbar='each', normalize=True, ylabeldate=True, fwidth=17.0, fheight=11.0, mask=False)¶

Plot all igrams containing the specified date

roipy.plot.date_map(tsInstance, prefix='RmpMskDef')¶

Map number of dates in timeseries inversion of each pixel

roipy.plot.date_variance(tsInstance, signalmask=None, prefix='RmpMskDef')¶

Calculate the average variance and standard deviation of all interferograms with a common date

roipy.plot.geo_correlate(arrayX, arrayY, order=1)¶

Pass cropped arrays on same grid from gmtsample() output. Arrays should have already been converted from LOS to Vertical

roipy.plot.get_distance(point1, point2, transObject)¶

Distance between two points in km

roipy.plot.hist(data, signalmask=None, nbins=50)¶

Plot histogram of interferogram

roipy.plot.ig_map(tsInstance, prefix='RmpMskDef', platform=None)¶

Map number of interferograms coherent per pixel

roipy.plot.make_profile(path, rasters=['stack282', 'dem_t282'], unit='degrees')¶

Need Path to ESRI format shape file output by ProfileFromLine in QGIS plot is a list of shapefile attribute raster values to put into profile assume profile distance measured in degrees & therefore approximate distance in meters

roipy.plot.pcolor(array, title=None)¶
roipy.plot.pcolor_ma(dataFile, maskFile=None)¶

load separate data and mask and plot

roipy.plot.pig(Interferogram, array=2)¶

bring up a pseudocolor image of any array associated with an interferogram poosible= phs,amp,look,head,cor. Array=nparray,1,2

roipy.plot.profile(array, val, ax='x')¶

Make a simple profile along a row or column of array in radar coordinates

roipy.plot.profile_VH(data)¶

averaged row & column profiles in radar coordinates

roipy.plot.profile_asterix(data, center=(311, 68), nprofiles=5, yex=(-0.5, 1))¶

Draw series of profiles through center point. Default center for t6089 x is column number, y is row #

roipy.plot.profile_average(data)¶

Don’t show profiles next to array

roipy.plot.profile_collapsed(data, center, yex=(-0.5, 1.0), nbins=100, markevery=10)¶

collapsed profile from arbitrary center point in array in radar coordinates

roipy.plot.project2utm(Point, epsg=32719, printout=True)¶

Transform point object in lat/lon to UTM 192 WGS84 (epsg=32719)

roipy.plot.showmap(path, dims=None)¶

Use Basemap module to plot a georeferenced interferogram

roipy.plot.side_by_side(array1, array2, array3, fixCaxis=True)¶

Plot two arrays with imshow, keep the same colorbar for each, third array has it’s own colorbar scale (eg. for residual)

roipy.plot.side_by_side_new(array1, array2, array3)¶
roipy.plot.simple_stack(tsInstance, prefix='Def', signalmask='mask.npy', clim='auto')¶

Do a simple stack of a directory of rect_unw interferograms with associated msk files used to crop noisy pixels. Date range is a tuple of beginning and end dates, to stack only the interferograms that fall in the given time span

roipy.plot.subset_map(tsInstance, file='pix2subsets_svd.mat')¶

Map rank of B matrix for each pixel. Number of subsets given by: L = (N+1) - Rank(A) where N is the number of dates in inversion

roipy.plot.summary(tsInstance, signalmask=None, prefix='RmpMskDef')¶

mean phase w/ standard deviation for rmp removed & filtered signal box is for t6089

roipy.plot.summary2(tsInstance, signalmask=None, prefix='RmpMskDef')¶

Just Plot Standar Deviations to remove colorbars

roipy.plot.synthetic_frames_asc(ts, fwidth=11.0, fheight=8.0, nrow=2, normalize=True, show=True)¶

Make a ‘proof sheet’ of all frames in time series

roipy.plot.timeseries(tsInstance, cumdef=None, index=('row', 'col'), order=1, title=None, save=False, style='default', biannual=False, showloc=False)¶

Plot the timeseries for a specified pixel default is uturuncu t10 data is the pix2cumdef array

roipy.plot.timeseries_separate(tsInstance, data=None, index=(1515, 135), order=1)¶

ERS dates plotted as green triangles, ENVISAT dates plotted as blue circles

roipy.plot.timespans(tsInstance)¶

Make a plot showing the timespans of all interferograms in a set

roipy.plot.timespans_dq()¶

Color points in timespan plot based on data quality

roipy.plot.vmap_stack(tsInstance, prefix='RmpMskDef', clim='auto')¶

Alternative to stack_binary in matlab

roipy.plot.vmap_timeseries(tsInstance, result='pix2avevel_svd.mat', clim='auto')¶

Read pix2avevel.mat from matlab routines

roipy.plot.vmap_timeseries_new(tsInstance, cumdef=None, clim='auto')¶

Use pix2cumdef.mat array from matlab routines
